doc:section:
Requirements To use &xist; you need the following software packages:
Python 2.2 (available from http://www.python.org/ and http://python.sf.net/),
The Python &xml; package (available from http://pyxml.sf.net/) (a version that includes sgmlop and expat),
the Python Imaging Library (available from http://www.pythonware.com/products/pil/)
The experimental eGenix mx Extension for Python (available from http://www.lemburg.com/files/python/eGenix-mx-Extensions.html).
FileUtils (available from http://www.livinglogic.de/Python/fileutils/),
ANSIStyle (available from http://www.livinglogic.de/Python/ansistyle/),
and a C compiler supported by distutils, if you want to install the source distribution.

doc:section.doc:title: Installation
doc:section.doc:par:
&xist; uses distutils, so installation is rather simple. Execute the following command:
python setup.py install
This will copy *.py files, compile *.c files and install everything in the site-packages directory as an xist package.
For Windows a binary distribution is provided. To install it, double click it, and follow the instructions.
If you have difficulties installing this software, send a problem report to Walter Dörwald (walter@livinglogic.de) describing the problem.

doc:section.doc:title: Character encoding
Display hook
doc:section.doc:par:
Currently &xist; nodes do not have a fancy __repr__ method implemented, but the repr method can be used to generate two different display formats (this is extensible by implementing new presentation classes). To use e.g. the TreePresenter format in object dumps in an interactive Python session you can use the displayhook feature of Python 2.1, simply by putting the following code into your Python startup script:
import sys, pprint from xist import xsc, presenters
def displayhook(object): if object is not None: if isinstance(object, xsc.Node): print object.repr(presenters.TreePresenter()) else: pprint.pprint(object)
sys.displayhook = displayhook

doc:section.doc:title: Syntax highlighting
doc:section.doc:par: If you want syntax highlighting in your &xist; tree dumps and have an &ansi; color capable terminal, set the environment variable XSC_REPRANSI to 1 or 2 depending on whether you have a light or dark background color. Setting XSC_REPRANSI to 0 turns off syntax highlighting.
